definitions.definition: confess to be true or to be the case, typically with reluctance.
examples: the office finally admitted that several prisoners had been injured
synonyms: divulge; plead guilty "Paul admitted that he was angry"

definitions.definition: confess to (a crime or fault, or one's responsibility for it).
examples: he was sentenced to prison after admitting 47 charges of burglary
synonyms: divulge; plead guilty "Paul admitted that he was angry"

examples: after searching for an hour, she finally had to admit defeat
senior citizens are admitted free to the museum
synonyms: welcome "he unlocked the door to admit her"

definitions.definition: (of a ticket) give (someone) the right to enter a place.
examples: the voucher admits up to four people to the theme park

definitions.definition: carry out the procedures necessary for (someone) to be received into a hospital for treatment.
examples: she was admitted to the hospital suffering from a chest infection

definitions.definition: allow (a person, country, or organization) to join an organization or group.
examples: Canada was admitted to the League of Nations
synonyms: register into "she was admitted to law school"

definitions.definition: allow (someone) to share in a privilege.
examples: the doctrine held that only a chosen few were admitted to the covenant
the courts can refuse to admit police evidence that has been illegally obtained
the need to inform him was too urgent to admit of further delay
